name: Kona Coast Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in building 18-203 and it was just lovely. Huge villa, great space for the money. Other hotels were half the size and double the price. Cleaning service was great. They vacuumed for like 45 minutes, did our dishes, dusted, took the trash out daily, and room was fully equipped. My villa was not ocean front/view. But we did get a glimpse of the sunset/gold course which was great as well
reviews.title: Excellent Stay!

reviews.text: This was an excellent holiday, which would have made even better with just a little more information. Arriving from the airport late at night, we found the check-in location with a little difficulty because of inadequate signage. Once there though, the staff was very friendly and helpful. However, one little piece of additional info would have made a world of difference. We asked if there were "ocean-view" units available and were told there were no ocean-view units in the resort at all. In fact, the resort is bordered on three sides by a golf course, over which you can see the ocean. Instead, we were directed to an interior spot with what had to be the noisiest air conditioning unit on the planet. If you go, ask for the rooms overlooking the golf course. They have quieter AC and better views.
reviews.title: Choose Your Unit Carefully

reviews.text: Having said that, we had a very large 2 bedroom unit with a well-stocked kitchen (except no kettle - Canadians like tea). It had a large fridge with water and ice. We had a dishwasher, coffee maker, washer and dryer.
reviews.title: Great size and in a good location

reviews.text: We had two bathrooms, one large ensuite with walk-in shower and a smaller (though not small) one with tub and shower. Plenty of towels.
reviews.title: my thoughts

reviews.text: It had a spacious lanai, with a large patio table, four chairs and a lounger, which we enjoyed except when the AC was blasting. AC costs an additional $11/day and we found that we didn't need it. There was an older 27" flat-screen and a really old 20" crt televsion, neither of which we ever turned on. Two king-size very comfortable beds plus a large sofa in the living room that pulled into a bed. Comfortable living room furniture, large dining room table and lots of cupboards everywhere would make this an excellent place for longer stays.
reviews.title: Great all over again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were very pleased with our one BR room. It was very spacious, high ceilings and nice view of the golf course from the balcony. The furnishings were in good condition, the washer/dryer came in handy, but the kitchen could use some updating. The fee for A/C was a little annoying but we used it and paid for it anyway. I understand that electricity costs more on an island, we live in Bermuda so we're used to that.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: The resort grounds were very well maintained, and the staff were always smiling and helpful. We attended the timeshare presentation so that we could get discounts on tours, and we didn't get pressured too badly once we said No Thanks afterward.
reviews.title: Great Place for Shell Elite Members

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would stay here again.
reviews.title: A Solid Above Average

reviews.text: As my family is spread out across the country, we try to have one family vacation a year. We booked 2 x 2 bedroom condos to accommodate my Mom + Step-dad, brother + his daughter, sister + her husband + daughter, and my wife + 2 sons + me. With 11 people, it seems like we would be cramped, but there was plenty of room. The children are all young so there was ample room for them to sleep and run around. To be honest, with the sofa bed, likely there would be enough room 5-10 years from now as well.
reviews.title: Little bit of Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each room had a master suite with separate bath and shower, 2nd room with 2 full sized beds, a 2nd large bathroom with very large shower, a full kitchen with appliances, washer and dryer, living room with sofa bed, and furnished patio. The beds were comfortable, and fairly firm. Overall the accommodations and furnishings were very nice.
reviews.title: Ups and downs. Accomodations are great; service, not so much.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a wonderful time at this property. The room was spacious, it was impeccably clean, the bed was comfortable and the kitchen was well equipped. It was a better value than I expected. I booked through a major website and got a good deal. it is near Ali Drive where several nice beaches are located. Staff is nice and there is a place where they rent gear and help you booking activities. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Spacious and modern one bedroom unit

reviews.text: This property is close to everywhere and easily accessible. Being our first time to Kona we were very pleased. I highly recommend it to anyone wanting to be near a beach and yet being able to drive around and see the sights.
reviews.title: Close to everything

reviews.text: I enjoy staying here the most of all the rental/time share resorts I have stayed at in Kona.
reviews.title: My favorite place to stay in Kona

reviews.text: Beautiful. Peaceful. Modern & everything kept up well. Nice big rooms and 2 bathrooms in even the 1 bedroom units makes it easy on family and guests.
reviews.title: Spacious 2 bedroom unit, peaceful & nicely updated

reviews.text: Nice pools including a quiet adults pool. Lots of BBQ and just across the street from grocery, small mall and restaurants w/ a movie theatre.
reviews.title: Aloha Fridays restaurant

reviews.text: The room at the Kona Coast was huge. We had a one bedroom and kitchen, then a split level for the living room and dining. The bath was large and the shower could fit 3 people. We had a small ocean view from the large patio. The kitchen was well stocked and had full size appliances, including washer and dryer. The kitchen is a little dated but it gets the job done. The staff is super nice and took care of any request immediately.The pool is nice and the bar was excellent. Great location and we had a garage. The air conditioning took time but, that has been my experience at other warm places. I would stay here again for sure.
reviews.title: Lots of room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our unit was a great size. Huge bathroom and shower. Also good kitchen and living room size. When we were in the unit, we spent most of our time on the lanai admiring the views of the water and the sunset especially as we enjoyed breakfast every morning. We were right above the quiet pool which was the pool we went to when we spent time on site. The activities center was great for renting chairs and umbrellas when we went to the beach. Very close to a grocery store, post office and good restaurants. Also within easy driving of Walmart, K-Mart and Target. We loved that we were close to the more bustling area of Kailua-Kona but were not right there in the middle of everything.
reviews.title: We loved our stay at Kona Coast Resort Unit 1-203

reviews.text: Great rooms, helpful staff. Many facilities - pool, BBQ, tennis, volley ball, shuffle board, ...
reviews.title: Great Family Resort - Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is great. A nice snorkeling shore about 5 minutes from there, a lot of shops and a grocery store 2 minutes from there and much more.
reviews.title: Great location, great value, so-so rooms

reviews.text: Kona coast resort is only a 20 minute drive from the KOA airport and is located on the west coast where all the great beaches are, so it's a great location. However, the rooms aren't the best - as soon as we walked in we were met with an awful musty smell....even after blasting the air conditioner for a couple of hours it was still there, probably from the carpets. The smell alone was enough to make us feel ill at ease in the room. Also, the resort staff kept encouraging us to visit the "activities centre", but we found out it was because they were trying to sign us up for a 2-hour timeshare presentation in return for "discounts" on a variety of tours (discounted price wasn't that much lower than other third party tours which had much better ratings), so we were a little turned off by that. However, given the location, the size of the rooms, free parking and wifi, it is still great value.
reviews.title: Feels like HOME!

description: The Kona Coast Resort on Hawaii's Big Island sits on 21 acres of lush, tropical gardens and offers spectacular views of palm trees and calm waters. 267 spacious and air-conditioned villas at Kona Coast Resort are designed with a Hawaiian flair. Each comfortable villa offers a magnificent Pacific coastline view or a manicured tropical garden view from its private lanai or patio and include full kitchens and all of the comforts of home. Enjoy two swimming pools (one family pool with a children’s pool and one quiet spa pool), three Jacuzzis, sauna, playground, tennis courts, volleyball, fitness center, and on-site activities like hula lessons and dive instruction. The abundance of things to do on the Big Island found within easy distance of the Kona Coast Resort is as remarkable as it is exhilarating.
